p: Although current research tends to integrate multi-disciplinary studies of avian influenza, it stops at the early stage of analytically integrating data, for example, on phylogenetic relationships between isolated occurrence of the virus, migratory bird movements, and trade in poultry and wild birds [21], [22] or implementing only basic statistical analysis between genetic distance and geographic distance [23]. Even though knowledge has been acquired in many different disciplines, adequate methods to quantify and integrate this knowledge for H5N1 remain poorly developed.
